txt.en: 'This is why we have come to treat with you. This invasion had nothing to do with the White Hand.'
'Humph! The Stag-clan is grown too weak to fight with us, Half-orc. You waste your breath.'
'The Dragons ignored our peaceful plan and devised their own violent invasion....'
'Wh-- what is the meaning of this?'
'This is no time for caution, [placeholder]. We must weaken them, and then attack with our full strength!'
'Peace, Guto of Lhan Tarren! And you, [placeholder] of a distant land.'
'We can pick them off from the hilltop. Come, follow me.'
'We have come only to speak with you.'
'Consider it an act of good will towards the Stag-clan. An apology for a...misunderstanding.'
'I heard something....'
'The Dragon-clan violated our trust. We never intended an attack upon Trum Dreng.'
'Be on your guard, [placeholder]! Someone approaches.'
'But the old enmity between that clan and yours was evidently too strong for this one's narrow mind.'
'Quiet, Dragon! You have already broken our trust. Do not make things worse for yourself.'
'Our true purpose here was a mission of friendship! Isengard offers its White Hand to you.'
'Guto of Lhan Tarren, please ignore my companion. We did not come here to fight.'
'Speak quickly, before my fists decide not to listen!'
'You dare to threaten the Dragon-clan?'
'You collaborate with our bitter enemy. They invade our lands, and kill our folk!'
'Saruman seeks war with the Horse-lords who stole your lands!'
'If you join us, the clans of Dunland shall unite, with the strength of Isengard at their backs!'
'...Revenge. Revenge against the Horse-men.'
'...And the clans of Dunland united as one?'
'My people have longed for this for many generations....'
'I accept your generous invitation, Guto. I look forward to speaking with your elder.'
'You must bring this message to Lhan Tarren.'
'My grandfather is chief, and he must hear this offer.'
